page.title: 03Epworth Leisure Centre.
page.content: The leisure centre, which opened last year, offers a wide range of activities from tennis to gymnastics. In the holidays children have the opportunity to use the facilities in a course called Summer Provisions. The only disadvantage is the cost. One thing which it does not provide is a{public swimming pool.}This was a big issue when the centre was first built. Before the Isle became Boothferry in 1974 a leisure centre was planned for Epworth but then the money was diverted to Goole. A golf course was also provided there before we finally had our leisure centre. The nearest swimming pool is at Scunthorpe twenty minutes from here. A pool is necessary in Epworth because not everyone has a car and public transport is expensive.
